title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y<x-1$$ $$0<0-1$$ $$0<-1$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y<x-1$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y<\frac{-1}{4} x+3$$ on the same grid.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y<\frac{-1}{4} x+3$$ $$0<0\frac{-1}{4}+3$$ $$0<3$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y<\frac{-1}{4} x+3$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the left side of the line $$y=\frac{-1}{4} x+3$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
